info.name: Structures
info.description:
This collection has been forked from standard structure and contains an intial folder structure and examples to aid in creating the required postman tests. Some folders contain scripts that should not be modified and will be indicated at the biginning of the script.

This collection should be named to reflect the Integrator it is testing.

item.name: LOVs
Examples
REST Example

item.description:
This folder contains the tests for the REST column named.

A Search test is required if the column is searchable, otherwise a Shortlist test is required. Note that neither of these tests are required if the column is not 'Is Sheet Column'. These test simulate the form field.

Should the column have loose dependencies, the test above should include all dependent values. A second 'Search/Shortlist no loose dependencies' test should be created that has all loose dependency values removed.

A MultiRow test is required to simulate validation and should contain multiple validation values.

item.name: OBIEE Example

exec: // IMPORTANT! When updating expectedQuery or expectedResults, please beautify this script afterwards via https://beautifier.io/
// REQUIRED: Define the report type - OBIEE or REST
// REQUIRED: Define the expected results as a JSON object. This can be obtained from the console when first being run
// NOTE: If the actual results change, make sure to analyse why they have changed before updating the expected results -
// - Simply overriding the expected results whenever the actual results change invalidates the test
// Set the formatted expected results as an environment variable
// OPTIONAL: Set array of columns to excluded from results comparrison eg ["LastUpdateDate","CurrentDate"]

body.raw:
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:pub="http://xmlns.oracle.com/oxp/service/PublicReportService" xmlns:soapenv="http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope">
    <soapenv:Body>
        <pub:runReport>
            <pub:reportRequest>
                <pub:reportAbsolutePath>REPORT_PATH</pub:reportAbsolutePath>
                <pub:sizeOfDataChunkDownload>-1</pub:sizeOfDataChunkDownload>
                <pub:attributeLocale>en-US</pub:attributeLocale>
                <pub:attributeTemplate>Default</pub:attributeTemplate>
                <pub:attributeFormat>xml</pub:attributeFormat>
                <pub:byPassCache>true</pub:byPassCache>
                <pub:flattenXML>false</pub:flattenXML>
                <pub:parameterNameValues>
                    <!-- <pub:item>
                        <pub:name>DEPENDENCY</pub:name>
                        <pub:multiValuesAllowed>true</pub:multiValuesAllowed>
                        <pub:values>
                            <pub:item></pub:item>
                        </pub:values>
                    </pub:item> -->
                    <!-- <pub:item>
                        <pub:name>REPORT_RESTRICT_FIELD</pub:name>
                        <pub:multiValuesAllowed>true</pub:multiValuesAllowed>
                        <pub:values>
                            <pub:item>Value1</pub:item>
                            <pub:item>Value2</pub:item>
                        </pub:values>
                    </pub:item> -->
                    <pub:item>
                        <pub:name>REPORT_SEARCH_FIELD</pub:name>
                        <pub:multiValuesAllowed>true</pub:multiValuesAllowed>
                        <pub:values>
                            <pub:item>ABC%</pub:item><!-- search fileds should restrict to return a few rows -->
                        </pub:values>
                    </pub:item>
                </pub:parameterNameValues>
            </pub:reportRequest>
        </pub:runReport>
    </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

item.description:
This folder contains the tests for the OBIEE column named.

A Search test is required if the column is searchable, otherwise a Shortlist test is required. Note that neither of these tests are required if the column is not 'Is Sheet Column'. These test simulate the form field.

Should the column have loose dependencies, the test above should include all dependent values. A second 'Search/Shortlist no loose dependencies' test should be created that has all loose dependency values removed.

A MultiRow test is required to simulate validation and should contain multiple validation values.

This folder contains examples for each type of LOV that can be duplicated as the starting point for your columns tests.

Do NOT duplicate this folder. It has a script that prevents its contents from being run when using the TestRunner environment. Instead, duplicate the required folder below this.

ie: either the REST or OBIEE Example

This folder must not be moved, renamed, or deleted.

<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:pub="http://xmlns.oracle.com/oxp/service/PublicReportService" xmlns:soapenv="http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope">
  <soapenv:Body>
    <pub:runReport>
      <pub:reportRequest>
        <pub:reportAbsolutePath>REPORT_PATH</pub:reportAbsolutePath>
        <pub:sizeOfDataChunkDownload>-1</pub:sizeOfDataChunkDownload>
        <pub:attributeLocale>en-US</pub:attributeLocale>
        <pub:attributeTemplate>Default</pub:attributeTemplate>
        <pub:attributeFormat>xml</pub:attributeFormat>
        <pub:byPassCache>true</pub:byPassCache>
        <pub:flattenXML>false</pub:flattenXML>
        <pub:parameterNameValues>
          <pub:item>
            <pub:name>_PARAM</pub:name>
            <pub:values>
              <pub:item>%</pub:item>
            </pub:values>
          </pub:item>
          <!-- exclude all sections in one request -->
          <pub:item>
            <pub:name>EXCLUDE__SECTION_PARAM</pub:name>
            <pub:values>
              <pub:item>Y</pub:item>
            </pub:values>
          </pub:item>
          <pub:item>
            <pub:name>HAS__BRANCH_CRITERIA_PARAM</pub:name>
            <pub:values>
              <pub:item>N</pub:item>
            </pub:values>
          </pub:item>
        </pub:parameterNameValues>
      </pub:reportRequest>
    </pub:runReport>
  </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

item.description:
This folder should contain sub-folders for each Download Source. Each Download Source folder then holds the specific request tests for that Download Source.

Create your download source folders by duplicating the specific folder from the Examples, rename the duplicate to your Source name, and move the new folder inside here.

item.name: Uploads
item.description: This folder contains all upload example payloads and responses. It has a script that prevents its contents from being run when using the TestRunner environment.

// NOTE: If the actual results change, make sure to analyse why they have changed before updating the expected results -
// - Simply overriding the expected results whenever the actual results change invalidates the test

// OPTIONAL: Set array of columns to excluded from results comparrison eg ["LastUpdatedBy","CurrentDate"]
// NOTE: the tags 'LastUpdateDate', 'Etag' and 'links' are added to these keys by the main script

* 4. FOR TESTING: Set TEST_MODE = true in the script to use static test data that demonstrates all color conditions
* 5. Update the expectedResults environment variable with the values from the console.
* 6. Should your data have changed, you can copy both the expectedResults and actualResults into a comparrison tool for analysis

* - 4: DEBUG - All debug output including detailed logs
* Set DEBUG_LEVEL to desired level - all messages at that level and above will be shown
